content: The Rewards of Wisdom
But let your heart keep my commandments;
For length of days and years of life [worth living]
And tranquility  prosperity [the wholeness of life’s blessings] they will add to you.
Do not let mercy  kindness and truth leave you [instead let these qualities define you];
Bind them [securely] around your neck,
Write them on the tablet of your heart.
So find favor and high esteem
In the sight of God and man.
Trust in  rely confidently on the  with all your heart
And do not rely on your own insight  understanding.
In all your ways know  acknowledge  recognize Him,
And He will make your paths straight  smooth [removing obstacles that block your way].
Do not be wise in your own eyes;
Fear the  [with reverent awe and obedience] and turn [entirely] away from evil.
It will be health to your body [your marrow, your nerves, your sinews, your muscles—all your inner parts]
And refreshment (physical well-being) to your bones.
Honor the  with your wealth
And with the first fruits of all your crops (income);
Then your barns will be abundantly filled
And your vats will overflow with new wine.
My son, do not reject  take lightly the discipline of the  [learn from your mistakes and the testing that comes from His correction through discipline];
Nor despise His rebuke,
For those whom the  loves He corrects,
Even as a father  the son in whom he delights.
